fields.description:
Connect-specific web resources need to be added both in the {{atl.general}} and the {{preview}} context in Confluence. The former should include the latter.

This caused [AC-703|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AC-703] in Connect.

See workaround added in [febee07|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-connect/commits/febee0760dccd4ad90624ab3cc18d5f49e47c4e2].

fields.description:
The Atlassian documentation doesn't explain clearly how to retrieve the body content of a Confluence macro in preview mode. It says :

"If you use the {macro.id} in your URL, the REST api will not return the macro body during a preview request, because the page has not been saved yet. You can use the {output.type} parameter to detect whether the macro is rendered in preview mode and adapt the response accordingly."

But the tutorial doesn't explain how to adapt the response accordingly

I asked this question on answers web site with some code example :
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/27330364/confluence-ondemand-cannot-display-macro-body-of-a-dynamiccontentmacros

Thanks

Xavier Arques
fields.summary: Clarify options for previewing macro body content

The least async calls, the better.

fields.description:
As a developer I would like to have a REST call that allows me to find out whether or not a specific user has administrative privileges. The main use case for this is that we have functions in our addon that require global admin privileges and we have some that only require space level admin privileges. We need a way to check if the user making the call is authorized to do so.

Suggestions for temporary workarounds are greatly appreciated, if there are specific operations that we could try doing and looking at the response.
fields.summary: User privileges REST endpoint

fields.description: Static content macros are cached if the request returns cache headers. We include user_key and user_id in the query parameters of all requests, so the cache is effectively only per-user. If none of the existing 10 add-ons with static content macros rely on this behaviour, we should remove the parameter to make the cache more effective. And change the documentation to make this clear.

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian team, I am developing a new landing page for our Confluence-based intranet, which heavily relies on the use of user macros. Unfortunately the deadline is approaching quickly now and I am running into nasty problems with the HTML created from passing Confluence macros, e.g. from the teamcalendar plugin, into my user macro with "rendered body" as $body. As you can see in the attached picture, when the teamcalendar macro is embedded directly into a page, or even into a user macro, it renders HTML(5), which fits the HTML5 doctype of the Confluence page. However, when passing the same macro as body of my user macro and rendering $body, e.g. inside an own div:
$body
. The HTML created by Confluence for $body seems to be XHTML, which breaks the HTML5 page structure. For some macros, e.g. the blogpost macro, everything works fine in the same setting. Am I doing something wrong? Is there a way to set something like a render mode from inside the user macro etc., which determines the type of HTML, which is output? Your help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you, Michael
fields.summary: Problem when embedding certain macros (e.g. teamcalendar) as $body in a user macro

Thanks

fields.description:
Hi Atlassians,

we are using our own custom theme for Confluence, which was created based on your tutorial https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/tutorials/writing-a-confluence-theme

The intention behind this was, to stay as close to the Atlassian default theme as possible, while still having the option to tweak some stuff. This has worked very nice through all of our previous Confluence versions, starting from 3.5.x over 4.3.7 to 5.6.6.

However, with our last update from 5.6.6 to 5.10.8 things have changed. The 'in-place' editing feature from Confluence 5.9 is not working with a custom theme. There are also some other issues (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-43965 and https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36861 for example) which are caused by custom themes still using editpage.action for edit action and not /rest/tinymce/1/content as the default theme now does.

What is Atlassians roadmap regarding custom themes for the future? Is the entire custom theming deprecated as the Documentation Theme https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/end-of-support-announcements-for-confluence-210239673.html#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforConfluence-Documentationtheme and will just be frozen in the current state? Or can we expect an update to the theme tutorials, so we can keep building our custom themes while also getting the benefits of new features like 'in-place' editing.

Thanks,
Tim
fields.summary: Custom Themes don't inherit 'in-place' editing feature from default theme

* Ensure the Confluence REST API methods [{{/rest/api/content/.../history/.../macro/hash/...}}|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/REST/latest/#d3e909] and {{/rest/api/content/.../history/.../macro/id/...}} (missing from REST API documentation) document the semantics of the fields in the body of the 404 response.
* Reference the REST API documentation above from the documentation of [the {{url}} parameter|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/confluence/static-content-macro.html#url]
* Update the example request in the documentation of [the {{url}} parameter|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/confluence/static-content-macro.html#url] to include handling of the 404 response with {{data.authorized = false}}.

See [Cloud add-on Permission Requirements|https://artemis.atlassian.net/wiki/display/GSI/General+Support+Info+Home#GeneralSupportInfoHome-Cloudadd-onPermissionRequirements] by [Artemis Software|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/vendors/84] for a vendor's perspective on this

fields.description:
Raised by K15t at Atlascamp, we need to look into whether the amount of storage taken up by copying Confluence pages with large numbers of attachments is likely to be an issue. Because it involves copying entire page trees each time a new version should be created, it has the ability to balloon out rapidly.

From [Notes from Atlascamp|https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/spaces/CP/pages/2938863625/Notes+from+Summit+AtlasCamp]:
{quote}Attachments - 25GB limit in storage for customers
* with space copy, is there risk about the size of an instance due to attachments being copied?
* Copy to another instance?
* Could we use the media API somehow?
* What is the actual storage limit?{quote}
fields.summary: Investigate storage limit issues for Space Publishing
Create integration test for previewing of dynamic content macros

fields.description:
Dear support,

For our automation needs, we are querying content from our Confluence instance through REST. No problem, works fine.

We use the default javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory to create a DocumenetBuilder. We feed the XML received from a REST call into this DocumentBuilder.

This fails for several reasons: the XML does not have the normal <?xml...> header, nor does it declare the correct namespaces for ac and ri etc. So before feeding it to the XML parser, we surround it with the required headers/footers.

That way, it works... most of the time.

But, Confluence uses a kind of XHTML and therefore the XML includes entity references such as & nbsp ; . Plain XML doesn't have these defined and therefore the DocumentBuilder complains with the following exception:
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The entity "nbsp" was referenced, but not declared. 

This is normal behavior, since XML can't know these entities. So, my question is, which headers and footers we should add to the content XML in order not to run into any issues.
Unresolved entity references (XHTML and some Confluence custom ones?)
Unforeseen namespaces (we currently cover ac and ri, but maybe there are others...)

Since you developed Confluence, I guess you have a perfect answer to this instead of us guessing for the right choice.

Ideally, as I requested, you would provide us with a XML document in which we can "paste" the XML storage format, rendering a perfectly valid XML document.
fields.summary: XML Parsing of page content obtained through REST API

fields.description:
Hi Dev-Team!

We use the Confluence remote-API "search" function in one of our products to detect changes made to Confluence content based on a timespan. We also use a Confluence user with administrative privileges for the remote-API access. This way it is possible to display all pages regardless of their permission settings. However, when there are viewing-restrictions on a page or space which do not include the admin-user, changes for these affected pages are not returned when using the remote-"search"-method but the page can be displayed by the user nonetheless.
Is this a known issue? Are there any plans on fixing this anytime soon? We do not really have a workaround for this situation since we do not see any other way to retrieve changes from Confluence other than the "search"-method.

Best regards
Tobias
fields.summary: Confluence remote API search does not return expected results

Currently copy page tree always copies all content properties of original page.  The requirement is to enable user to supply a include/exclude list, so that only the selected properties are copied.
This was a requirement voiced by Comalatech during connect week.  A further conversation is necessary before we develop this feature.
fields.summary: Allow Copy Page Tree API to optionally include/exclude content properties

fields.description:
I'm trying to include batik-anim, batik-bridge, and batik-svg-dom as dependencies for our add-on.  However, doing this causes a run-time exception:

{code}java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserFactoryImpl cannot be cast to javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.batik.dom.util.SAXDocumentFactory.<clinit>(Unknown Source)
	at com.lucidchart.core.svg.parser.SVGParser.parse(SVGParser.java:56)
	at com.lucidchart.core.svg.importer.SVGImporter.convert(SVGImporter.java:30)
	at com.lucidchart.core.svg.common.SVGConverter.importSVG(SVGConverter.java:23)
	at com.lucidchart.onprem.confluence.servlets.ImportVisioAttachment.importSvgFromStream(ImportVisioAttachment.java:371)
	at com.lucidchart.onprem.confluence.servlets.rest.Shapes.doPost(Shapes.java:80)  
{code}

I've tried a variety of exclusions and dependencies, but it either won't compile:
{code}
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.5.1:compile (default-compile) on project lucid-onprem-confluence: Compilation failure
[ERROR] /home/tpope/lucid/main/visio-service/app/com/lucidchart/core/svg/parser/SVGParser.java:[64,20] cannot access org.w3c.dom.xpath.XPathEvaluator
[ERROR] class file for org.w3c.dom.xpath.XPathEvaluator not found
{code}
if I exclude too many things, or causes the error with different SAXParserFactory classes.

I tried advice from several online sources:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/19696121/answers/27329731
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/104121/im-blocked-help-cannot-be-cast-to-javax.xml.parsers.saxparserfactory
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11677572/dealing-with-xerces-hell-in-java-maven
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19992400/classcastexception-org-apache-xerces-jaxp-documentbuilderfactoryimpl-cannot-be
that seemed to have similar problems, but to no avail.

I've attached our version.xml along with our pom.xml in a state that compiles but throws the runtime error, with most of the excludes that I've tried currently in it.
fields.summary: Using batik svg libraries causes problems with xerces.

fields.description: !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Doc of getMacroData and saveMacro:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/javascript/module-Confluence.html

It should be improved:

* To say that getMacroData and saveMacro are only usable at custom editor dialog (https://legacy-developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/macro-editor.html)
* Macro data is macro parameters,
 they are the same (https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/macro-input-parameter.html)
* From normal view mode page, to get macro data/parameters, developers should use "url" in atlassian-connect.json (https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/confluence/dynamic-content-macro.html)
fields.summary: Improve doc to clearly say that getMacroData and saveMacro are only usable at custom editor dialog

fields.description: The [documentation for Blueprints|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/confluence/blueprint.html] in Connect is super minimal, we should expand it out more. It needs an overview of what Blueprints actually are, what you can do with them, plus a description on how to write a Blueprint template.
fields.summary: Expand the Blueprint Documentation

fields.summary: Space level ECTs have a default list view
Navigator API: allow navigating to connect page modules

fields.description:
This is unclear in Connect Document about the limitation in Custom Editor URL.
Url context parameters are not supported for custom editor url.  This is not consistent to other url value we can use for connect addon.  Currently Navigation API is the only alternative for editor to determine contentId etc context for page.  This needs to be either documented clearly or improved other wise.
In V3 custom param is sent to addon url using GET, but in V5 it is missing, and it is a regression from existing feature.

*For example:*
{code}
"editor": {
          "url": "/my-macro-editor?content_id={content.id}"
}
{code}
*Expected:*
editor will be called using GET /my-macro-editor?content_id=<some real id>

*Actual:*
editor is called using GET /my-macro-editor?content_id=

*Workaround*

Call {{AP.navigator.getLocation(...)}} to obtain the content ID.
fields.summary: Support context parameters in macro editor URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
This comes from CE-1125 which is affecting my customer base. Since Confluence is including {{atl.general}} web panel incorrectly, our web panel is being rendered multiple times on the page (even though it should be there once).

In Connect we don't have a way of knowing if we're already on the page or the context of where we are being rendered which we can do in p2.
fields.summary: API to see other web panels rendered on a page

fields.description: Add a web panel to the user profile popup so add-ons can add custom information.
fields.summary: Add a WebPanel to User Profile Popup

fields.description:
The call in question is the following:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/modules/fragment/image-placeholder.html

For our Lucidchart Add-On, we wanted to make the placeholder dynamic, so that it displays a thumbnail of an actual diagram being inserted right inside the editor. This provides a much better user experience, especially if there are several instances of the same macro inserted in a page. See the attached screenshot for illustration.

The problem is that currently the placeholder call is not signed, meaning there is no auth data coming with it. To work around it, we currently actually store the {{consumerId}} among other data inside macro parameters to make sure it gets passed with the call, and use it to fetch the right diagram thumbnail, **bypassing the normal authentication flow**. We obvuously wouldn't want to keep such solution out there.

[~aholmgren], [~cwhittington], [~pbrownlow] we discussed this during the office ours at the summit, you mentioned that currently assume that placeholders are always static images, but let's work this out. Thanks so much for your time going through our issues!
fields.summary: Macro image placeholder call is not signed

fields.description:
Spec: https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CE/Spec%3A+Render+iframes+with+POST

Update: 
The rendering iframes with POST approach has been ditched due to Chrome throwing XSS warning.
The new approach is fixing the AP.confluence.getMacroBody() method.

It is blocked by a generic issue that connect iframes can't be initialised inside a non-connect iframe
More details are described here:
https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/spaces/CE/pages/2377842697/How+to+preview+dynamic+macros+in+ACJS+v5
fields.summary: Dynamic macros should be able to previewed

fields.description:
Hi there,

In a nutshell, the customer created a group, put all the add-ons system users there, and removed the permissions for the add-ons. 

I tested on my instance, and uninstalling the add-ons and installing them again recovered the permissions. I tested in Confluence with exactly the same add-ons, but they were on trial for me. 

He uninstalled and installed again "copy space" and "copy tree" add-ons on his instance and now he is having licensing problems.

Can someone please point me on how to proceed? 

The ticket is this one: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-358669
fields.summary: Licensing problems: customer uninstalled add-ons, reinstalled
Adaptavist 2.0.7 license

fields.description:
Add a helper method to the AP confluence object to allow for easier collection of the macro body.

The thing to consider here is that all the context information will still need to be added to the uri-template of this method will not be possible.  So the change here is to decide if adding these parameters to all requests is appropriate.
fields.summary: Add getMacroBody method to AP

fields.description: Currently, when no location is defined in the add-on descriptor for a general page, it will default to using system.browse. Since Confluence 5.0 this is no longer a supported location, so pages defined in this way will have their webitem placed in the help menu.
fields.summary: Change default General page location to something more logical than the help menu

fields.description:
While implementing the keyboard shortcuts in Connect, we uncovered that there is significant amount of effort for the keyboard shortcuts to work in Confluence. We descoped the work, but most of the work is already complete. The problems which arised are

- the shortcut descriptor class is not exported in osgi
- keyboard shortcuts coming from atlassian.shortcuts are not vertigo friendly as a 0-tenant module. This need to be changed and released as a new version.
fields.summary: Add support for Keyboard short modules in Confluence

{noformat}
fields.summary: Delete large number of attachments

fields.description:
When copying a page tree we would like the operation to preserve the original page's creation and modification date.

Example:
Original page has two revisions. When enabling the new option the copy of that page would have the creation date of the first revision and the last modification date of the second revision.

Rationale:
This would be required for archiving content. The byline would then look the same for both original and copy.
fields.summary: Provide an option for copyPageTree REST API to preserve original page dates

Confluence Web Components

fields.description:
In one of our add-ons we have to process page_created webhook events for Confluence.

Based on these events we have to execute a call to check for a certain label respectively a label with a certain prefix set on this page. If we find the label we will execute some actions e.g. setting content properties on the page etc.
The whole process has to been very fast - as less latency as possible.

Thus we would like to reduce the amount of communication by having the label information of the page contained in the event.

(This is a alternative request for https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AC-1824)
fields.summary: Include labels in page_created webhook body

fields.description:
Hi Support,

I have developed a plugin controlled-pm-for-confluence for Cloud Confluence.
Unfortunately, it is not working. The error message is:
We can't create that blueprint right now.
There's a problem with Controlled Project Management(David Koudela).

Based on https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/blueprint-template-context.html, I have requested a log.
The only one related message says:
@40000000581a87ac087f58ac 2016-11-03 01:41:06,140 WARN [LandlordServiceAcceptTenantThread] [confluence.util.profiling.DurationThresholdWarningTimingHelperFactory] logMessage Execution time for publishing event com.atlassian.plugin.event.events.PluginModuleAvailableEvent for com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:com.davidkoudela.confluence.controlled-pm-for-confluence__controlledpm-bptemplate-link-content-template (null) to listener class com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.ConfluencePluginManager took 868 ms (warning threshold is 200 ms)

I have verified that my service https://controlledpm.herokuapp.com is working well.
Additionally, I can see an access of the blueprint context on the service side:
2016-11-04T08:09:44.730740+00:00 heroku[router]: at=info method=POST path="/bptemplates/context" host=controlledpm.herokuapp.com request_id=0365f067-1eda-454a-b59f-b00408397840 fwd="131.103.29.216" dyno=web.1 connect=1ms service=4ms status=405 bytes=1520

Unfortunately, I cannot easily debug the Cloud Confluence part.

Could you please help me to resolve such issue?

Thanks a lot,
David.

P.S.: Related Ticket:
https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-233339
fields.summary: Blueprint plugin controlled-pm-for-confluence not working on davidkoudela.atlassian.net
